sen.j: 准如（じゅんにょ、1577年8月3日（天正5年7月9日 (旧暦)） － 1631年1月2日（寛永8年11月30日 (旧暦)））は安土桃山時代、江戸時代の人物。
sen.e: Junnyo (August 3, 1577 (July 9, 1577 (old lunar calendar)) - January 2, 1631 (November 30, 1631(old lunar calendar))) is a person in Azuchi Momoyama Period and Edo Period.
sen.cmt: 旧暦寛永8年11月30日は1632年になり、寛永7年の誤りと思われますが、そのまま訳しました。[http://kotobank.jp/word/%E5%87%86%E5%A6%82]
sen.e: Junnyo (August 3, 1577 (July 9, 1577 (old lunar calendar)) - January 2, 1631 (November 30, 1631(old lunar calendar))) is an individual from the Azuchi Momoyama Period and Edo Period.
Junnyo (August 3, 1577 - January 21, 1632) was an individual from the Azuchi-Momoyama period and Edo period.
sen.cmt: 西暦に計算しなおし表記を変え、過去形にしました。

sen.e: He was the 12th Monshu, Hongwanji-ha head priest, of Hongwan-ji Temple.
He was the 12th Monshu, Hongwanji-ha head priest, of Hongwan-ji Temple.
He was the 12th Monshu (a head priest) of Hongan-ji Temple.

sen.j: 十一世門主の顕如の三男で、教如の弟。
sen.e: He was the third son of Kennyo, the 11th Monshu, and a brother of Kyonyo.
He was the third son of Kennyo, the 11th Monshu, and a brother of Kyonyo.
He was the third son of Kennyo, the 11th Monshu, and a brother of Kyonyo.
A posthumous name was Kosho.
The posthumous name was Kosho.
His imina (a personal name) was Kosho.

sen.j: 准如が父と対立した兄に代わって門主を継いだことをきっかけに、本願寺は東西に分裂した。
sen.e: Triggered by Junnyo's succession of Monshu instead of his brother who was at outs with their father, Hongwan-ji Temple split to east and west.
Triggered by Junnyo's succession to Monshu, instead of his brother, who was at odds with their father, Hongwan-ji Temple split into east and west.
Triggered by Junnyo's succession to Monshu, instead of his brother, who was at odds with their father, Hongwan-ji Temple split into east and west.

sen.j: 石山戦争の折、父顕如は織田信長と和睦し、1580年に石山本願寺を退去、紀伊国鷺森に移った。
sen.e: At the Ishiyama War, his father Kennyo made peace with Nobunaga ODA and went away from Ishiyama Hongwan-ji Temple to Saginomori Kii Province.
After the Ishiyama War, his father Kennyo made peace with Nobunaga ODA and departed from Ishiyama Hongwan-ji Temple to Saginomori Kii Province.
In the Ishiyama War, his father Kennyo made peace with Nobunaga ODA and departed from Ishiyama Hongan-ji Temple to Saginomori of Kii Province in 1580.
sen.cmt: 1580年を補足し、表現を変えました。

sen.j: その後、顕如は豊臣秀吉に寺地を与えられ大坂天満に移ったが、1591年秀吉により現在の本願寺の地である京都の七条堀川に再び寺地を与えられ移転。
sen.e: After that, Kennyo moved to Osaka Temma given a land of temple by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, and moved to Shichijo Horikawa in Kyoto (present location of Hongwan-ji Temple) given a land by Hideyoshi again in 1591.

After that, Kennyo moved to Osaka Temma, upon being given the land of a temple by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, and moved to Shichijo Horikawa in Kyoto (the present location of Hongwan-ji Temple) after being given land again by Hideyoshi again 1591.

After that, Kennyo moved to Osaka Tenma, upon being given the land of a temple by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, and moved to Shichijo Horikawa in Kyoto (the present location of Hongan-ji Temple) after being given land again by Hideyoshi again in 1591.

sen.j: これに伴い准如も京都に入るが、翌1592年に顕如が没すると、1593年に准如が本願寺第十二世を継いだ。
sen.e: In accordance with this, Junnyo entered Kyoto and assumed the 12th Monshu of Hongwan-ji Temple in 1593 after Kennyo had died in 1592.
In accordance with this, Junnyo entered Kyoto and assumed the 12th Monshu of Hongwan-ji Temple in 1593 after Kennyo died in 1592.
As a result, Junnyo also came to Kyoto and, when Kennyo died the following year (1592), he succeeded to Kennyo's position, becoming the 12th Monshu of Hongan-ji Temple in 1593.
sen.cmt: 翌、を補足し、表現を変えました。I can't see why 本願寺 has been rendered as "Hongwan-ji" so I have changed it to the more usual rendering of "Hongan-ji".

sen.j: 西本願寺の主張によると、もともと兄の教如は1580年の石山本願寺退去の折、織田氏への抗戦継続を断念した父に背いて石山本願寺に篭るなど父と不仲で、また、織田氏を継承した秀吉にも警戒されており、自然と准如が立てられるようになったという。
sen.e: According to the opinion of Nishi Hongwan-ji Temple, his brother Kyonyo was basically at outs with his father, as seen in the case that he kept to Ishiyama Hongwan-ji temple as opposed to his father who gave up resistance against Oda clan at the time of withdrawal from that, and was watched out by Hideyoshi who succeeded Oda clan, so that Rennyo became Monshu naturally.

According to the opinion of Nishi Hongwan-ji Temple, his brother Kyonyo was basically at odds with his father, as seen in the case that he kept to Ishiyama Hongwan-ji temple, as opposed to his father, who gave up resistance to the Oda clan at the time of withdrawal, and was protected by Hideyoshi who succeeded the Oda clan, so that Rennyo became Monshu naturally.

Nishi Hongan-ji Temple claimed that Junnyo's brother Kyonyo was basically at odds with their father, as was evident when he withdrew to Ishiyama Hongan-ji Temple in 1580 despite his father having given up his resistance to the Oda clan, and he was closely watched by Hideyoshi as well when he succeeded Oda Nobunaga, so it was natural that Rennyo became the next Monshu.
sen.cmt: 表現を変えました。The revised translation was still pretty confusing.

sen.j: 顕如の次男である顕尊（教如の同母弟）は准如の後見人として自分の娘を正室として迎えさせるなど准如の支持に回った。
sen.e: Kenson, the second son of Kennyo (half brother of Kyonyo) supported Junnyo as his guardian, making his daughter marry with him.
Kenson, the second son of Kennyo (half brother of Kyonyo) supported Junnyo as his guardian, forcing his daughter to marry him.
Kenson, the second son of Kennyo (half brother of Kyonyo) supported Junnyo as his guardian, forcing his daughter to marry him.

sen.j: 最終的に准如の母が信長の家臣であった秀吉に頼み込んで三男の相続が実現したという。
sen.e: It is said that the succession by Junnyo was realized because his mother asked Hideyoshi, who was a follower of Nobunaga, finally.
It is said that the succession by Junnyo was realized because his mother asked Hideyoshi, who was a follower of Nobunaga, in the end.
It is said that succession to the position of Monshu by Junnyo, the third son, was eventually realized when his mother turned to Hideyoshi, who was then a vassal of Nobunaga, for help.
sen.cmt: 三男、を補足し表現を変えました。

sen.j: 准如自身も兄の教如とは異母兄弟で(母は同じ如春尼という説もある)折り合いが悪かったとされる。
sen.e: It is said that Junnyo himself was at outs with his half brother Kyonyo (there is another theory that his mother was Nyoenni as same as Junnyo).
It is said that Junnyo himself was at odds with his half brother Kyonyo (there is another theory that his mother was Nyoenni, the same as Junnyo).
It is said that Junnyo was at odds with his half-brother Kyonyo as well (there is, however, another theory that suggests his mother may have shared the same mother as Junnyo, Nyoshun-ni).
sen.cmt: Nyoshun-niとし、表現を変えました。

sen.j: しかし、豊臣秀吉の死後、豊臣家を倒した徳川家康は教如を支持し、1602年に教如に烏丸七条に寺地を与えて東本願寺が建立された。
sen.e: However, after Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI died Ieyasu TOKUGAWA who defeated Toyotomi family supported Kyonyo and gave a land for temple in Karasuma Shichijo to Kyonyo in 1602, which led to the establishment of Higashi Hongwan-ji Temple.

However, after Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI died, Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, who defeated the Toyotomi family, supported Kyonyo and gave land for a temple in Karasuma Shichijo to Kyonyo in 1602, which led to the establishment of Higashi Hongwan-ji Temple.

However, after Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI died, Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, who defeated the Toyotomi family, supported Kyonyo and gave land for a temple in Karasuma Shichijo to Kyonyo in 1602, which led to the establishment of Higashi Hongwan-ji Temple.

sen.j: このため准如が継承した七条堀川の本願寺は西本願寺と呼ばれるようになり、本願寺教団は東西に分裂した。
sen.e: For this reason the Hongwan-ji Temple in Shichijo Horikawa which Junnyo succeeded became to be called Nishi Hongwan-ji Temple, which led to the split of east and west of Hongwan-ji Temple group.
For this reason, the Hongwan-ji Temple in Shichijo Horikawa, which Junnyo succeeded, became to be called Nishi Hongwan-ji Temple, which led to the east-west split of the Hongwan-ji Temple group.
For this reason, the Hongwan-ji Temple in Shichijo Horikawa, which Junnyo succeeded, became to be called Nishi Hongan-ji Temple, which led to the east-west split of the Honganji Buddhist Sect.

sen.j: その後、准如は1608年に勅命により大僧正となり、大坂に津村別院を、江戸に築地別院を建立して西本願寺の拡大に努めた。
sen.e: After that, Junnyo assumed Daisojo (high priest) by Imperial order in 1608 and made efforts to widespread the influence of Nishi Hongwan-ji Temple, building Tsumura Betsuin branch temple in Osaka and Tsukiji Betsuin branch temple in Edo.

After that, Junnyo assumed Daisojo (high priest) by Imperial order in 1608 and made efforts to broaden the influence of Nishi Hongwan-ji Temple, building Tsumura Betsuin branch temple in Osaka and Tsukiji Betsuin branch temple in Edo.

After that, Junnyo assumed daisojo (a Buddhist priest of the highest order) by Imperial order in 1608 and made efforts to broaden the influence of Nishi Hongan-ji Temple, building Tsumura Betsuin branch temple in Osaka and Tsukiji Betsuin branch temple in Edo.
